Fabric is a toolchain consisting of:

Fabric Loader: Manages the injection of modded code into java-based games.
Fabric Loader isn't just for Minecraft! It can be applied to other games such as Mindustry.
Fabric API: Fabric API is a set of events and utility methods that can aid modders in creating content.
Fabric Loom: Fabric Loom manages the development environment by merging the client and server jars together and applying mappings, such as yarn.
Fabric Installer: Fabric Installer simply installs the Fabric Loader for users to use.

children.value: You will also need to configure Fabric Loom to load the access widener - or your mod will not compile if you use anything that has been modified.
Notice for Minecraft Development IntelliJ Plugin users
you can simply right click any field, method or class and click the
button in the dropdown - you can paste the copied entry into your access widener file.
The access widener file syntax is pretty simple to understand.
At the top of the file is the access widener declaration - this must always exist as it tells Fabric Loader how to parse the access widener entries.
The declaration format is as follows:

props.code: accessWidener   {version}   {mappings namespace}

children.value: Mappings type refers to one of the following:
Comments are supported, the line must start with a hashtag:

props.code: # This is a comment.

children.value: To widen access to a class, the following format must be used:

props.code: {access type} class {class name}

children.value: Only two access types can be used on class entries:
- Used when you want to access the class from another class.
All methods in the class are made public - if the method is private, the method is made final.
All fields in the class become public.
- Used when you want to extend the class or override a method.
The class itself becomes public and final is removed if it exists on the class.
All methods are made protected and final is removed if it exists on the method.

props.code:
# This is an example of a class entry.
accessible class net/minecraft/item/FoodComponent

children.value: # This is an example of a class entry.

props.code: {access type}   method   {class name}   {method name}   {method descriptor}

props.code: {access type}   field   {class name}   {field name}   {field descriptor}
